channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Karen Ruddelle sentenced to 11 and a half months' home detention
item.description: The systemic disadvantage suffered by Māori helped to create the conditions in which Karen Anne Ruddelle stabbed and killed the man she loved, a judge has found.

item.title: Auckland's Third Main rail line works begin
item.description: Auckland Deputy Mayor Bill Cashmore says the start of work on a third main rail line from Quay Park to Wiri is vital to the future growth of areas south of the city.

item.title: Environmental group 'incredibly disappointed' about mining permit
item.description: An environmental group said a permit granted this week to a mining company in the south Coromandel showed the government had failed its promise there would be no new mines on Department of Conservation land.

item.title: Christchurch mosque shooter's sentencing: Live reporting banned
item.description: Live reporting from the sentencing of the Christchurch mosques gunman has been banned.

item.title: Oranga Tamariki accused of 'appalling' treatment of parents with intellectual disabilities
item.description: Oranga Tamariki has been accused of "appalling" and "brutal" treatment of parents with intellectual disabilities when taking their children from them.

item.title: Covid-19 update: No new cases in New Zealand today
item.description: There have been no new cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand's managed isolation and quarantine facilities today.

item.title: Man found dead on Coromandel highway named
item.description: After Bayden Williams was found dead on State Highway 25A, a 23-year-old man has appeared in court charged with murder.

item.title: Pursuit abandoned after shots fired at police in South Auckland
item.description: The hunt is on for two people who shot at police out of a car window in South Auckland last night.

item.title: Covid-19 border exemptions for workers 'as scarce as winning lottery tickets'
item.description: A think tank wants the government to put border exemptions up for auction so companies can bid to bring in overseas executives and key workers.

item.title: US flight touches down in Christchurch ahead of international Antarctic season
item.description: The first American flight bringing personnel taking part in the international Antarctic season touched down in Christchurch this morning.

item.title: Chemical stored in Sawyers Bay, but ‘risk is minimal’
item.description: Explosive material stored near Dunedin has sparked concerns after the deadly explosion in Lebanon.

item.title: Police seize firearms, drugs, arrest three in Taumarunui
item.description: Three people have been arrested following multiple search warrants in Taumarunui.

item.title: CovidCard will be better used than tracing app, academic says
item.description: An academic is upbeat about the bluetooth-powered CovidCard, saying it is a step up from the QR code system that is currently in place for contact tracing.

item.title: Christchurch Mayor Lianne Dalziel's husband dies after battle with cancer
item.description: The husband of the Christchurch mayor Lianne Dalziel has died after a battle with cancer.

item.title: MP credits man who led charge to save Nikau House
item.description: Nelson's MP has credited the man who bravely went public about his mental health experiences, for helping to save a community mental health facility.

item.title: Failed Ruataniwha dam still causing contention as council agrees to relieve financial stress of backers
item.description: A rural council in Hawke's Bay has agreed to relieve the financial stress of a controversial group that owns the rights to a failed dam project. But some think ratepayers shouldn't be picking up the bill.

item.title: Mask orders boom after New Zealanders told to be ready, but Brownlee queries timing
item.description: Mask manufacturers are receiving massive orders after the government says people will be encouraged to wear them if the country returns to alert level 2.

item.title: Problems found in design of two Auckland-Northland bridges
item.description: Problems have been identified with two new bridges being built on the Auckland Northern Corridor highway project, prompting NZTA reviews.
